p: The selected medicinal plants were extracted with two methods, maceration and decoction, producing 8 ethanolic and 8 aqueous extracts as shown in Table 1 and Figure 1. Among the ethanolic extracts obtained, G. mangostana, N. sativa, S. aromaticum, and P. emblica yielded greater than 10%, that is, 23.81, 22.07, 18.79, and 13.11%, respectively. S. trilobatum, S. indicum, G. glabra, and M. elengi produced medium-to-low yield, that is, 7.67, 6.77, 6.08, and 1.23%, respectively. With decoction, those giving higher yields were P. emblica, S. trilobatum, G. glabra, N. sativa, S. aromaticum, S. indicum, and G. mangostana with 22.11, 19.64, 15.33, 13.31, 13.15, 12.98, and 12.73%, respectively. M. elengi gave the lowest yield of 0.62%.
